description:
Joutarou Aragaki, former member of the national team, had given his whole life for gymnastics and was fighting against his age and physical strength. However, one day he is told by his coach to start thinking of his next career. Joutarou struggles, but his daughter, Rei, is always there by his side. But with one fateful encounter, the Aragakis’ lives change drastically.

(Source: Funimation)

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Athletics
tags.description: Centers around sporting events that involve competitive running, jumping, throwing, or walking.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Acrobatics
tags.description: The art of jumping, tumbling, and balancing. Often paired with trapeze, trampolining, tightropes, or general gymnastics.

tags.name: Dancing
tags.description: Centers around the art of dance.

tags.name: Ninja
tags.description: Prominently features Japanese warriors traditionally trained in espionage, sabotage and assasination.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Gyaru
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who has a distinct American-emulated fashion style, such as tanned skin, bleached hair, and excessive makeup. Also known as gal.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/saifumi_) | [Website](http://saifumi-profile.blog.jp/)

Japanese-Korean animator originating from Miyuki Production. Currently freelance.

__Graduated:__ Kunitachi College of Music (Department of Composition)

[Artist Profile (Miracle Bus)](http://miraclebus.com/composer/masaruyokoyama) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/masaruyokoyama)

**Yokoyama Masaru** is a Japanese composer, arranger, keyboardist and programmer affiliated with Miracle Bus.

[Profile](https://vims.co.jp/talent_profile_detail.php?id=7) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kaji__official) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yuki_kaji_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCx2XAGS0FoG9S6r0bhNo2UA)

Kaji has won several awards, including Best Voice Actor at the 12th Tokyo Anime Awards (2013), Best Actor at the 7th Seiyu Awards (2013), and Best Voice Actor at the 36th Anime Grand Prix (2014).

Married voice actress [Ayana Taketatsu](https://anilist.co/staff/101996/) in 2019.

__Non-Anime Roles:__

Former Head of the Production Department at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/). Currently Producer at Chocolate Inc.

[Profile (Animo Produce)](https://animoproduce.co.jp/artists/onokensho/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ono_kensho) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kenshoono1005/)

Married to voice actress [Kana Hanazawa](https://anilist.co/staff/95185/).

**Non anime roles:**

- Harry Potter - *Harry Potter* franchise (Live action films; JP dub)
- [Diluc Ragnvindr](https://anilist.co/character/187554/) - *Genshin Impact* (Video Game)
- Enforcer - *Arknights* (Mobile Game)
- Miles Morales - *Spider-Man: Into The Spider Verse; Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse* (Films; JP dub)
- Strohl - Metaphor: ReFantazio (Video Game)

Kozue Kananiwa graduated from the HOSEI University of Tokyo, Faculty of Letters, Department of Japan Literature. Her first work as a producer was for [Oh! My Goddess](https://anilist.co/anime/50/Aa-Megamisama-TV/) in 2005.

Since, she participated in the production many renown series such as [Mahou Shoujo Madoka☆Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/Mahou-Shoujo-MadokaMagica/) in 2011, [Steins;Gate](https://anilist.co/anime/9253/SteinsGate) the same year, or more recently [Horimiya](https://anilist.co/anime/124080/Horimiya/).

Now, she is the General Manager of  both U-NEXT Anime & Book Division and of the Production Department.

(Source : Bangumi 番組計画RC3)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kimu777)

Makoto Kimura is an animation producer originally from Fuji TV Noitamina. He then moved to [Twin Engine](https://anilist.co/studio/6199/Twin-Engine) and later then to Studio [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/MAPPA) where he was the Director of Planning Department. In April 2024, he left MAPPA and formed BLUE RIGHTS Co. Ltd.

_Note: Not to be confused with the background artist [Makoto Kimura](https://anilist.co/staff/182523/)._
Director and General Manager of CGI Department at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/). He's also a Board Member at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).
